title.narrative: Greening Mobility through Electric Motorcycles in Cambodia

description.narrative: The project objective is to analyze and propose potential opportunities for accelerating the transition to electric motorcycles. GGGI partners with RGC to deliver the Green Climate Fund (GCF) Readiness and Support Project, “Promoting Green Mobility through Electric Motorcycles.”

With strong economic growth in recent years, the number of vehicles has been growing rapidly in Cambodia. In 2016, more than 3.2 million vehicles were registered. Motorcycles accounted for 2.7 million vehicles of the total registered vehicles. Vehicle registration has grown at a rate of 14% from 2015 to 2016. In 2015, the transport sector represented over 45% of final energy consumption in Cambodia, entirely from imported petroleum products. As there is no domestic fuel source, the country fully relies on imports. Considering that much of the petroleum products are consumed in transport, there is high potential for positive climate change impact by switching conventional vehicles to greener alternatives. Transitioning away from ICEs (Internal Combustion Engine) to EVs (Electric Vehicles) will contribute to reducing GHG emissions in the congested urban area, together with significant co-benefits such as improvement in air quality, reduction of noise, and positive impacts on public health. Electric motorcycles with a lithium-ion battery are currently more expensive to purchase than gasoline motorcycles, but their total cost of ownership including lifetime operating costs is often lower than that of gasoline motorcycles. This implies that the adoption of electric motorcycles could be accelerated with the right set of supporting policies, if incentive mechanisms are provided to consumers to lessen the burden of higher purchase costs and if consumers’ uncertainty about the performance of electric motorcycles is eased through awareness programs.

mailing-address.narrative: Global Green Growth Institute, 19F Jeongdong Bldg., 21-15 Jeongdong-gil, Jung-gu Seoul 04520 Republic of Korea

title.narrative: [GCF Deliverable 4.3.1 bis] two workshops on project concept note conducted
[GCF Deliverable 4.3.1] One project concept note developed
Reduced GHG emissions Improved air quality
[GCF Outcome 4] Climate finance strategies and project pipeline strengthened
[GCF sub-Outcome 4.4] Market preparation and business planning for deployment and scale-up of prioritized climate technology solutions
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.1] Situation analysis of the transport sector in Cambodia conducted
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.2] Market and technical assessment for e-motorcycles, including a supply chain analysis, is conducted and summarized in a report
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.3 bis] Workshop on economic, environmental and social assessment conducted
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.3] Economic, environmental and social assessment (including gender/poverty) for electrification of motorcycles is conducted and summarized in a report
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.4] Policy and regulatory gap analysis to facilitate the deployment of e-motorcycles conducted
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.5 bis] A workshop on financing mechanism for the deployment of e-motorcycles is conducted
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.5] A financing mechanism for the deployment of e-motorcycles is developed and summarized in a report
[GCF Deliverable 4.4.6] Education and communication needs are assessed and identified
